metadata.description: This Disable Automatic Install of Internet Explorer components setting prevents Internet Explorer from automatically installing components.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Disable Automatic Install of Internet Explorer Compoents

metadata.title: Disable Changing Automatic Configuration Settings
metadata.description: This setting specifies to automatically detect the proxy server settings used to connect to the Internet and customize Internet Explorer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Disable Changing Automatic Configuration Settings

metadata.title: Disable Showing the Splash Screen
metadata.description: The Disable showing the splash screen setting prevents the Internet Explorer splash screen from appearing when users start the browser.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Disable Showing the Splash Screen

metadata.title: Disable Software Update Shell Notifications on Program Launch
metadata.description: The Disable software update shell notifications on program launch setting specifies that programs using the Microsoft Software Distribution Channel will not notify users when they install new components.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Disable Software Update Shell Notifications on Program Launch

metadata.title: Do Not Allow Users to enable or Disable Add-Ons is disabled
metadata.description: The Do not allow users to enable or disable add-ons policy setting allows you to manage whether users have the ability to allow or deny add-ons through Manage Add-ons.

Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Do Not Allow Users to enable or Disable Add-Ons does not exist

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Make Proxy Settings Per-Machine (Rather Then Per-User)
metadata.description: The Make proxy settings per – machine (rather than per-user) setting ensures proxy settings for all users of the same computer are the same.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Make Proxy Settings Per-Machine (Rather Then Per-User)

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Prevent participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Programs
metadata.description: This policy setting prevents users from participating in the Customer Experience Improvement Program (CEIP).

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Prevent participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Programs

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Prevent performance of First Run Customize settings
metadata.description: This policy setting prevents performance of the First Run Customize settings ability and controls what the user will see when they launch Internet Explorer for the first time after installation of Internet Explorer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Prevent performance of First Run Customize settings

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Add/Delete Sites
metadata.description: The Security Zones: Do not allow users to add/delete sites setting prevents users from adding or removing sites from security zones. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Add/Delete Sites

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Change Policies
metadata.description: The Security Zones: Do not allow users to change policies setting prevents users from changing security zone settings. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Do Not Allow Users to Change Policies

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Use Only Machine Settings
metadata.description: Applies security zone information to all users of the same computer. A security zone is a group of Web sites with the same security level. If you enable this policy, changes that the user makes to a security zone will apply to all users of that computer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Security Zones: Use Only Machine Settings

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off "Delete Browsing History" functionality
metadata.description: This policy setting prevents users from performing the "Delete Browsing History" action in Internet Explorer. If you enable this policy setting, users cannot perform the "Delete Browsing History" action in Internet Options for Internet Explorer 7.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off "Delete Browsing History" functionality

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn Off Crash Detection
metadata.description: The Turn off Crash Detection policy setting allows you to manage the crash detection feature of add-on management in Internet Explorer. If you enable this policy setting, a crash in Internet Explorer will be similar to one on a computer running Windows XP.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn Off Crash Detection

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off Managing Phishing Filter
metadata.description: This policy setting allows the user to enable a phishing filter that will warn if the Web site being visited is known for fraudulent attempts to gather personal information through "phishing."

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off Managing Phishing Filter
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off Managing Phishing Filter

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off the Security Settings Check feature
metadata.description: This policy setting turns off the Security Settings Check feature, which checks Internet Explorer security settings to determine when the settings put Internet Explorer at risk.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Turn off the Security Settings Check feature

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Prevent Ignoring Certificate Errors
metadata.description: Internet Explorer treats as fatal any Secure Socket Layer/Transport Layer Security (SSL/TLS) certificate errors that interrupt navigation (such as "expired," "revoked," or "name mismatch" errors).

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Prevent Ignoing Certificate Errors

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Active Content from CD's to Run on User Machine
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users receive a dialog requesting permission for active content on a CD to run. If you enable this policy setting, active content on a CD will run without a prompt.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Active Content from CD's to Run on User Machine

metadata.title: Allow Install On Demand (Internet Explorer)
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can automatically download and install Web components (such as fonts) that can installed by Internet Explorer Active Setup. For example, if you open a Web page that requires Japanese-text display support, Internet Explorer could prompt the user to download the Japanese Language Pack component if it is not already installed. If you enable this policy setting, Web components such as fonts will be automatically installed as necessary. If you disable this policy setting, users will be prompted when Web Components such as fonts would be downloaded. If you do not configure this policy, users will be prompted when Web Components such as fonts would be downloaded.

criterion.comment: Allow Install On Demand (Internet Explorer) is Disabled

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid
metadata.description: Microsoft ActiveX controls and file downloads often have digital signatures attached that vouch for both the file's integrity and the identity of the signer (creator) of the software. Such signatures help ensure that unmodified.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Software to Run or Install Even if the Signature is Invalid

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Third-Party Browser Extensions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer will launch COM add-ons known as browser helper objects, such as toolbars.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Allow Third-Party Browser Extensions

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Automatically Check for Internet Explorer Updates
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer checks the Internet for newer versions.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Automatically Check for Internet Explorer Updates

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Check for Server Certificate Revocation
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer will check revocation status of servers' certificates.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Check for Server Certificate Revocation

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Check for Signature on Downloaded Programs
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer checks for digital signatures (which identifies the publisher of signed software and verifies it hasn't been modified or tampered with) on user computers before downloading executable programs.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Check for Signature on Downloaded Programs

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Do Not Allow Resetting Internet Explorer Settings
metadata.description: This policy setting prevents users from using the Reset Internet Explorer Settings feature. Reset Internet Explorer Settings will allow the users to reset all settings changed since install, delete browsing history and disable add-ons that are not preapproved.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Advanced Page \Do Not Allow Resetting Internet Explorer Settings

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Sites: Include all network paths (UNCs)
metadata.description: This policy setting controls whether URLs representing UNCs are mapped into the local Intranet security zone. If you enable this policy setting, all network paths are mapped into the Intranet Zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Intranet Sites: Include all network paths (UNCs)

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Site to Zone Assignment List
metadata.description: Computer-wide, rather than per-user, assignment of sites to zones for Internet Explorer should be enabled or disabled as appropriate.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Site to Zone Assignment List = not configured

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Access data sources across domains
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Internet Explorer can access data from another security zone using the Microsoft XML Parser (MSXML) or ActiveX Data Objects (ADO).

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Access data sources across domains

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow cut, copy, or paste operations from the clipboard via script
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether scripts can perform a clipboard operation (for example, cut, copy, and paste) in a specified region. If you enable this policy setting, a script can perform a clipboard operation.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow cut, copy, or paste operations from the clipboard via script

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow drag and drop or copy and paste files
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can drag files or copy and paste files from a source within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, users can drag files or copy and paste files from this zone automatically.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow drag and drop or copy and paste files

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow font downloads
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether pages of the zone may download HTML fonts. If you enable this policy setting, HTML fonts can be downloaded automatically.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow font downloads

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow installation of desktop items
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can install Active Desktop items from this zone. The settings for this option are: If you enable this policy setting, users can install desktop items from this zone automatically.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow installation of desktop items

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage restrictions on script-initiated pop-up windows and windows that include the title and status bars. If you enable this policy setting, Windows Restrictions security will not apply in this zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow Scriptlets
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether scriptlets can be allowed. If you enable this policy setting, users will be able to run scriptlets. If you disable this policy setting, users will not be able to run scriptlets.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow Scriptlets

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow status bar updates via script
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether script is allowed to update the status bar within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, script is allowed to update the status bar.

notes.note: 03-21-2007 - Jon Baker - based on guidance received to date I have modified this definition to result in true if the specified registry key has a value of 0 or does not exist. At some point the variable associated with check of the registry key value should be removed since it may no longer be needed.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow status bar updates via script
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Allow status bar updates via script

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Automatic prompting for file downloads
metadata.description: This policy setting determines whether users will be prompted for non user-initiated file downloads. Regardless of this setting, users will receive file download dialogs for user-initiated downloads.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Automatic prompting for file downloads

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Download signed ActiveX controls
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download signed ActiveX controls from a page in the zone. If you enable this policy, users can download signed controls without user intervention.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Download signed ActiveX controls

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Download unsigned ActiveX controls
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download unsigned ActiveX controls from the zone. Such code is potentially harmful, especially when coming from an untrusted zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Download unsigned ActiveX controls

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage ActiveX controls not marked as safe. If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX controls are run, loaded with parameters, and scripted without setting object safety for untrusted data or scripts.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Java permissions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Internet Zone\Launching applications and files in an IFRAME

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow META REFRESH
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether a user's browser can be redirected to another Web page if the author of the Web page uses the Meta Refresh setting (tag) to redirect browsers to another Web page.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow META REFRESH

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage restrictions on script-initiated pop-up windows and windows that include the title and status bars. If you enable this policy setting, Windows Restrictions security will not apply in this zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow script-initiated windows without size or position constraints

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow status bar updates via script
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether script is allowed to update the status bar within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, script is allowed to update the status bar.

notes.note: 03-21-2007 - Jon Baker - based on guidance received to date I have modified this definition to result in true if the specified registry key has a value of 0 or does not exist. At some point the variable associated with check of the registry key value should be removed since it may no longer be needed.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow status bar updates via script is disabled
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Allow status bar updates via script does not exist

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Automatic prompting for file downloads
metadata.description: This policy setting determines whether users will be prompted for non user-initiated file downloads. Regardless of this setting, users will receive file download dialogs for user-initiated downloads.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Automatic prompting for file downloads

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Download signed ActiveX controls
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download signed ActiveX controls from a page in the zone. If you enable this policy, users can download signed controls without user intervention.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Download signed ActiveX controls

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Download unsigned ActiveX controls
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users may download unsigned ActiveX controls from the zone. Such code is potentially harmful, especially when coming from an untrusted zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Download unsigned ActiveX controls

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage ActiveX controls not marked as safe. If you enable this policy setting, ActiveX controls are run, loaded with parameters, and scripted without setting object safety for untrusted data or scripts.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Initialize and script ActiveX controls not marked as safe

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Java permissions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Java permissions

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Launching applications and files in an IFRAME
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether applications may be run and files may be downloaded from an IFRAME reference in the HTML of the pages in this zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Launching applications and files in an IFRAME

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Logon options
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage settings for logon options. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose from the following logon options.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Logon options

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Loose or un-compiled XAML files
metadata.description: These are eXtensible Application Markup Language (XAML) files. XAML is an XML-based declarative markup language commonly used for creating rich user interfaces and graphics that leverage the Windows Presentation Foundation.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Loose or un-compiled XAML files

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Navigate sub-frames across different domains
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage the opening of sub-frames and access of applications across different domains. If you enable this policy setting, users can open sub-frames from other domains and access applications from other domains.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Navigate sub-frames across different domains

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Open files based on content, not file extension
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage MIME sniffing for file promotion from one type to another based on a MIME sniff. A MIME sniff is the recognition by Internet Explorer of the file type based on a bit signature.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Open files based on content, not file extension

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run .NET Framework-reliant components not signed with Authenticode
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether .NET Framework components that are not signed with Authenticode can be executed from Internet Explorer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run .NET Framework-reliant components not signed with Authenticode

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run .NET Framework-reliant components signed with Authenticode
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether .NET Framework components that are signed with Authenticode can be executed from Internet Explorer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run .NET Framework-reliant components signed with Authenticode

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run ActiveX controls and plugins
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether ActiveX controls and plug-ins can be run on pages from the specified zone. If you enable this policy setting, controls and plug-ins can run without user intervention.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Run ActiveX controls and plugins

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Script ActiveX controls marked safe for scripting
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether an ActiveX control marked safe for scripting can interact with a script. If you enable this policy setting, script interaction can occur automatically without user intervention.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Script ActiveX controls marked safe for scripting

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Scripting of Java applets
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether applets are exposed to scripts within the zone. If you enable this policy setting, scripts can access applets automatically without user intervention.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Scripting of Java applets

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Software channel permissions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage software channel permissions. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose the following options from the drop-down box.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Software channel permissions

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Turn Off First- Run Opt-In
metadata.description: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Turn Off First- Run Opt-In

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Turn Off First- Run Opt-In

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Turn On Protected Mode
metadata.description: The "Turn on Protected Mode" setting should be configured correctly for the Restricted Sites Zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Turn On Protected Mode

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Use Pop-up Blocker
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether unwanted pop-up windows appear. Pop-up windows that are opened when the end user clicks a link are not blocked. If you enable this policy setting, most unwanted pop-up windows are prevented from appearing.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Use Pop-up Blocker

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Userdata persistence
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage the preservation of information in the browser's history, in favorites, in an XML store, or directly within a Web page saved to disk.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Userdata persistence

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Web Browser Applications
metadata.description: These are browser-hosted, ClickOnce-deployed applications built using WinFX. These applications execute in a security sandbox and harness the power of the Windows Presentation Foundation platform for the Web.

notes.note: 03-21-2007 - Jon Baker - based on guidance received to date I have modified this definition to result in true if the specified registry key has a value of 0 or does not exist. At some point the variable associated with check of the registry key value should be removed since it may no longer be needed.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Web Browser Applications is disabled
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Web Browser Applications does not exist

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Web sites in less privileged Web content zones can navigate into this zone
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether Web sites from less privileged zones, such as Restricted Sites, can navigate into this zone.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Restricted Sites Zone\Web sites in less privileged Web content zones can navigate into this zone

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone\Display mixed content
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage whether users can display nonsecure items and manage whether users receive a security information message to display pages containing both secure and nonsecure items.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone\Display mixed content

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone\Java permissions
metadata.description: This policy setting allows you to manage permissions for Java applets. If you enable this policy setting, you can choose options from the drop-down box. Custom, to control permissions settings individually.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Page\Trusted Sites Zone\Java permissions

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic Check for Updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools\Turn Off changing the URL to be displayed for checking updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools.
metadata.description: This policy setting allows checking for updates for Internet Explorer from the specified URL, included by default in Internet Explorer.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic Check for Updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools\Turn Off changing the URL to be displayed for checking updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic Check for Updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools\Turn Off Configuring the Update Check Interval (In Days)
metadata.description: This setting specifies the update check interval. The default value is 30 days. If you enable this policy setting, the user will not be able to configure the update check interval. You have to specify the update check interval.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Internet Settings\Component Updates\Periodic Check for Updates to Internet Explorer and Internet Tools\Turn Off Configuring the Update Check Interval (In Days)

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Enable Native XMLHttp Support
metadata.description: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Enable Native XMLHttp Support

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Enable Native XMLHttp Support

metadata.title: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Consistent Mime Handling\Internet Explorer Processes
metadata.description: Internet Explorer uses Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (MIME) data to determine file handling procedures for files received through a Web server. This policy setting determines whether Internet Explorer requires that all file-type information provided by Web servers be consistent. For example, if the MIME type of a file is text/plain but the MIME sniff indicates that the file is really an executable file, Internet Explorer renames the file by saving it in the Internet Explorer cache and changing its extension. If you enable this policy setting, Internet Explorer requires consistent MIME data for all received files. If you disable this policy setting, Internet Explorer will not require consistent MIME data for all received files. If you do not configure this policy setting, Internet Explorer requires consistent MIME data for all received files.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Consistent Mime Handling\Internet Explorer Processes
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Consistent Mime Handling\Internet Explorer Processes
Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Consistent Mime Handling\Internet Explorer Processes

metadata.description: MIME sniffing is the process of examining the content of a MIME file to determine its context — whether it is a data file, an executable file, or some other type of file.

criterion.comment: Computer Configuration\Network\Internet Explorer\Internet Control Panel\Security Features\Mime Sniffing Safety Feature\Internet Explorer Processes

metadata.description: Internet Explorer allows scripts to programmatically open, resize, and reposition various types of windows. Often, disreputable Web sites will resize windows to either hide other windows or force you to interact with a window that contains malicious code.

metadata.title: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Configure Outlook Express
metadata.description: The Configure Outlook Express setting allows administrators to enable and disable the ability for Microsoft Outlook Express users to save or open attachments that can potentially contain a virus.

metadata.title: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Disable AutoComplete for forms
metadata.description: This AutoComplete feature suggests possible matches when users are filling up forms. If you enable this setting, the user is not suggested matches when filling forms. The user cannot change it.

User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Disable AutoComplete for forms

metadata.title: User Configuration\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Disable external branding of Internet Explorer
metadata.description: Prevents branding of Internet programs, such as customization of Internet Explorer and Outlook Express logos and title bars, by another party.

metadata.description: Prevents users from restoring default settings for home and search pages. If you enable this policy, the Reset Web Settings button on the Programs tab in the Internet Options dialog box appears dimmed.
